summary.para: Gets the address of a pointer to the interface, which contains additional sort column values.

param.name: riid
param.para: A reference to the identifier of the requested interface.

param.name: ppv
param.para: When this method returns successfully, contains the address of a pointer to an interface.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: The following is an example usage for this method. When sorting by System.Author: System.DateModified, System.DateCreated, and System.ItemNameDisplay may be used as secondary sort columns. This ensures a unique sort order (for System.Author) and is used to provide a more consistent user experience.
Calling applications include any UI that wants the secondary sort columns for a given property.

summary.para: Gets the address of a pointer to the interface containing the primary sort column.

param.name: riid
param.para: A reference to the identifier of the requested interface.

param.name: ppv
param.para: When this method returns successfully, contains the address of a pointer to the interface for the calling object.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

summary.para: Exposes methods to get the "sort by" columns properties for an item. This interface is used by UI objects that want to retrieve the primary or secondary sort columns for a given property.
